title.narrative: Global poverty action fund and the programme partnership arrangements - Evaluation Manager

description.narrative: DFIDs Global Poverty Action Fund (GPAF) and the Programme Partnership Arrangements (PPAs) will provide £480 million of both unrestricted and restricted funding to approximately 225 civil society organisations between 2011 and 2015, with the aim of contributing to DFIDs goals of alleviating poverty and promoting peace, stability and good governance. Coffey is leading an evaluation to assess the performance of both the individual CSOs receiving the funding and the GPAF and PPA funding mechanisms themselves. The results of the evaluation will inform future DFID policy and funding decisions regarding support to civil society organisations as a means for contributing to the Millennium Development Goals and good governance.

sector.narrative: Improved capacity within DFID Civil Society Department (CSD) and delivery partners to make evidence-based decisions concerning policy and programmes relating to civil society to ensure maximum impact and value for money is achieved from investments. It is anticipated that the use of the evidence produced in decision-making processes will lead to the following impact: DFID Civil Society Department makes evidence-based policy and programme decisions with respect to investments to achieve maximum impact on poverty reduction and acts as an effective and influential partner in supporting civil society
